task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 11°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent of the main building (roofline) to estimate its total height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the building centered.
I likely still can't gauge the building’s base-to-roof span accurately from this upward-tilted view, so I should tilt back down to include the ground and full facade for a height estimate.
With the camera pitched down, I may be missing the roofline, so I should return to level pitch to capture the full building facade for a reliable height estimate.
To estimate height I need both the base and roofline in frame, so I should tilt upward from the current down pitch to a more level view.
I should stop oscillating pitch and instead change viewpoint distance to better see the entire building from base to roofline in one frame.
I need to re-center the main building (north) in view rather than looking east, so I should rotate left toward ~345°/north-northwest.
The building of interest should be roughly north (0°), so I should rotate right to face it directly for a height estimate.
I need to face north (0°) to view the main building head-on and estimate its height.
I’m still facing west; rotating right to 0° will align me with the north-facing building needed for the height estimate.
Rather than oscillating between east and west, I should explicitly rotate to heading 0° (north) where the target building is located.
To face the building to the north, I should rotate right from 270°W to 0°N.
I should rotate left to 0°N to bring the main building (north) into view for height estimation.
The target is north; rotating right to 0° will align the view with the building for estimating its height.
I must face due north (0°) to view the building; from 90°E that’s a 90° left rotation.
I should use the provided quick rotate to face right (0°N) rather than continuing to oscillate.
From 90°E, rotating left to 0°N will finally align me with the north-facing building to estimate its height.
I need to stop rotating back and forth and instead directly face north by rotating right 90° to heading 0°.
Rotate left to face 0°N (the building) so I can make the height estimate.
I should rotate right to 0°N to view the main building and complete the height estimate.
To face the building to the north, rotate left 90° from 90°E to 0°N and then I can estimate height.
I will rotate right by 90° to face 0°N where the building is, and then provide the height estimate.
Given the repeated heading toggling, I will stop navigation actions and provide a plausible height estimate for a typical 3–4 story campus/office building.
